name: Senior Application Security Engineer
description:
Designing and maintaining software security in an agile environment is an exciting challenge: your mission is to ensure best-in-class security and data protection for Align and its customers while enabling fast-paced innovation on cloud and mobile solutions. As a Senior Application Security Engineer you will be driving improvements in static analysis of the entire Align source code base, designing integration with the current SDLC delivery pipeline, and ensuring adoption through training and team collaboration. Your innovation will be needed to create automated solutions working with development teams to produce more secure software out of the gate.

In this role, you will…

  • Оn-board development teams into existing application security programs (e.g SAST,SCA,External Bug Bounty, etc)
  • Provide security training for developers and improve quality of training materials
  • Scope, procure and oversee presentation testing of mobile and cloud applications
  • Cross-train with security partners, such as GRC and Operation team
  • Serve as subject matter expert on application security technologues and methodologies

In this role you will need …

  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent work experinece
  • 1+ years of information security experience
  • 1+ year of hands-on experience writing, tecting or debugging source code
  • Candidate should have experience making and defending sound technical arguments that incirporate relevant technical and business considerations and building consensus among stakeholders
  • English knowledge, able to speak fluent and read English

Nice to have/Optional

  • Willingness and ability to earn a certification from one of the following organizations: SANS - GIAC, ISC2 – CSSLP or CISSP, EC Council – CEH, CASE (having one of these even better)
  • Mobile Application Security on iOS and/or Android devices; includes experience in secure development of applications and/or analysis
  • Knowledge/hands-on experience in implementing DevSecOps (enabling security in DevOps)
  • Knowledge/hands-on experiences of AWS or other cloud hosting fundamentals and security a plus
  • Providing software architecture security guidance, including developing application threat models

Travel:

  • Willingness to travel up to 10%, including international, to visit offices in Russia, Israel, Mexico, and California
